Name: SQL Injection
Description: The application is vulnerable to SQL injection, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary SQL queries.

Name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
Description: The application does not properly sanitize user input, allowing attackers to inject malicious scripts.

Name: Broken Authentication
Description: The application allows brute-force attacks on the login page due to weak authentication mechanisms.

Name: Sensitive Data Exposure
Description: The application transmits sensitive data (e.g., passwords) over unencrypted channels.

Name: Security Misconfiguration
Description: The server exposes unnecessary information (e.g., server version) in HTTP headers.
